item.title: The phone is dead. Long live . . . what exactly?
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: "We're not going to be using iPhones in 10 years," Callaghan says flatly. "I kind of don't think we'll be using them in five years."

item.title: The best AI-powered dictation apps of 2025
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: AI-powered dictation apps are useful for replying to emails, taking notes, and even coding through your voice

item.title: VCs predict enterprises will spend more on AI in 2026 — through fewer vendors
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Enterprises have been experimenting with AI tools for a few years. Investors predict they will start to pick winners in 2026.

item.title: Meta just bought Manus, an AI startup everyone has been talking about
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Meta says it'll keep Manus running independently while weaving its agents into Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, where Meta's own chatbot, Meta AI, is already available to users.

item.title: 2025 was the year AI got a vibe check
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: AI’s early-2025 spending spree featured massive raises and trillion-dollar infrastructure promises. By year’s end, hype gave way to a vibe check, with growing scrutiny over sustainability, safety, and business models.

item.title: Plaud Note Pro is an excellent AI-powered recorder that I carry everywhere
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Plaud Note Pro is a $179 notetaker, which is an excellent recording device first

item.title: How to use the new ChatGPT app integrations, including DoorDash, Spotify, Uber, and others
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Learn how to use Spotify, Canva, Figma, Expedia, and other apps directly in ChatGPT.

item.title: VCs predict strong enterprise AI adoption next year — again
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: More than 20 venture capitalists share their thoughts on AI agents, enterprise AI budgets, and more for 2026.

item.title: OpenAI is looking for a new Head of Preparedness
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: OpenAI is looking to hire a new executive responsible for studying emerging AI-related risks in areas ranging from computer security to mental health.

item.title: India startup funding hits $11B in 2025 as investors grow more selective
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Startup funding rounds in India fell sharply in 2025 as investors concentrated capital into fewer companies.

item.title: Equity’s 2026 Predictions: AI Agents, Blockbuster IPOs, and the Future of VC
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Rebecca Bellan, Anthony Ha, Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: TechCrunch’s Equity crew is bringing 2025 to a close and getting ahead on the year to come with our annual predictions episode! Hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan were joined by Build Mode host Isabelle Johannessen to dissect the year’s biggest tech developments, from mega AI funding rounds that defied expectations to the rise of “physical AI,” and make […]

item.title: Nvidia to license AI chip challenger Groq’s tech and hire its CEO
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: With Groq on its side, Nvidia is poised to become even more dominant in chip manufacturing.

item.title: The year data centers went from backend to center stage
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Data centers are no longer the boring tech issue they once were.

item.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.

item.title: Why the operating room is ripe for AI, according to Akara
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between, from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to […]

item.title: Waymo is testing Gemini as an in-car AI assistant in its robotaxis
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Waymo is testing a Gemini-powered in-car AI assistant, per findings from a 1,200-line system prompt. The assistant can answer general knowledge questions, control certain in-cabin features, and more.

item.title: Italy tells Meta to suspend its policy that bans rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Italy has ordered Meta to suspend its policy that bans companies from using WhatsApp's business tools to offer their own AI chatbots on the popular chat app.

item.title: Can AI fix the operating room? This startup thinks so
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to guesswork about room […]

item.title: John Carreyrou and other authors bring new lawsuit against six major AI companies
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: These authors rejected Anthropic's class action settlement, arguing that "LLM companies should not be able to so easily extinguish thousands upon thousands of high-value claims at bargain-basement rates."

item.title: Marissa Mayer’s new startup Dazzle raises $8M led by Forerunner’s Kirsten Green
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Mayer launched Dazzle after shuttering her photo and contact management startup Sunshine. Green’s investment suggests Dazzle is poised for the coming wave of new AI-infused consumer businesses.
